meanings.definition: A person who calculates or computes numbers.
meanings.sent1: The figurers in the accounting department are busy preparing the financial reports.
meanings.sent2: Math class requires students to be skilled figurers to solve complex problems.
meanings.sent3: The figurers at the bank made a mistake and accidentally added an extra zero to the balance.
meanings.sent4: She was a master figurer, always able to quickly estimate the total without using a calculator.
meanings.sent5: The figurer meticulously checked each calculation to ensure accuracy.

meanings.definition: A symbol or numeral used in mathematics.
meanings.sent1: The teacher wrote various figurers on the whiteboard to explain the algebraic equation.
meanings.sent2: In geometry, different figurers like circles and triangles have specific properties.
meanings.sent3: The child thought the figurers on the test looked like little aliens trying to communicate.
meanings.sent4: The figurers on the page danced around, forming patterns that seemed to tell a story.
meanings.sent5: The student struggled to remember the names of all the figurers used in geometry class.

meanings.definition: A person who is prominent or influential in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: As a figurer in the fashion industry, she set trends with her unique designs.
meanings.sent2: The CEO was a respected figurer in the business world, known for his innovative strategies.
meanings.sent3: The figurer of the art community was always seen at gallery openings and exhibitions.
meanings.sent4: She became a figurer in the music industry after her hit song climbed the charts.
meanings.sent5: The figurer in the technology sector was invited to speak at conferences around the world.
